Grok, the AI-powered chatbot created by xAI and widely deployed across its new corporate sibling X, wasn't just obsessed with white genocide this week. As

But you still haven't said, did even this supposed "saddest LLM" still get the summary right?

Microsoft opened FY26 with powerful momentum. Revenue hit $77.7B, up 18%. Microsoft Cloud climbed 26% to $49.1B. Azure surged 40% despite capacity constraints, a rare signal of demand exceeding supply.

Hyperscalers Are Quietly Rewriting the Global IT Economy

Back with Win9x WU also was this new & basically optional thing that many people couldn't reliably use due to dial-up and kin. Hence MSFT didn't rely on it too much, and instead just released half-way releases like Win95 SR2 and Win98 SE as patched-up upgrades, much like NT service packs.

People kept saying that forced Windows Updates rolled into a big amorphous blob was the future as finally all Windows systems would be fully patched up.

Of course it made things worse, especially with all the vibe coding at MSFT...

Also MSFT and these companies aren't idiots.  They're not generally going to shovel money at a part vendor years in advance of actually needing the part.  They might place an order (which frankly is enough for manufacturer bank financing), and even take delivery, but hold out on payment/invoicing.

ianal, but it's pretty clear that at least Google and MSFT have had essentially a cached copy of the whole shebang for years. I suspect it's about how you use it, so probably okay that you have it, I think?

Everything they've been up to, from ads in the Start Menu, requiring an MSFT account instead of just a local login, and increasingly pervasive opt-out (if you even can) surveillance, is certainly an interesting social experiment!

Google follows MSFT pricing strategy

MSFT killed PowerBuilder with cheaper VisualBasic.

VB was sold along with all other developer products. It was almost free.

Most developers switched to VB. 

Same is happening with antigravity.

Google can keep it free longer than cursor stay float.
S4 P1 as we used to say at MSFT. Priority is not the same as severity.

The spread on #MSFT default swaps (CDS) is remarkably wide for a AAA rated company, By comparison, protection on #JohnsonJohnson JJ - the other US company rated AAA, cost about 19bp a year on Thursday.

A 5y #CDS to protect $10 million of #MSFT debt from #default would cost about $34,000 annually, or 34bp on Thursday. In mid-Oct, it was closer to $20,000 a year, chart @markets finance.yahoo.com/news/wall-st...

I don't see much difference between OpenAI, MSFT, TSLA & other 'Big Seven' meme stocks and meme coins, TBH.

The main problem is basically where all the invested money got siphoned off to, and investment funds imploding along with the bubble. Nvidia will be fine. Investors won't be.

I doubt e.g. OpenAI will get that honour. It'll be mostly MSFT and kin who'll be in trouble, but the biggest problem will be all the money that is being siphoned via scam companies like OpenAI.

That's a lot of 401(k) money invested in scam stocks before the inevitable rug pull.
